title: Exclusion of Aadhaar from Bihar SIR: SC observes 11 docs more 'voter friendly' than 7
content: The Supreme Court has observed that the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) in Bihar, requiring 11 documents, is more voter-friendly than the previous summary revision's seven. Despite arguments against excluding Aadhaar, the court highlighted the inclusionary nature of the extensive document list. Petitioners, however, argued that the documents have limited coverage among the population, citing low passport ownership.

title: Jaishankar to visit Russia, hold talks with Lavrov amid tension with US
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar will meet Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov on August 21. This meeting follows increased tariffs imposed by the US on Indian imports. National Security Advisor Ajit Doval recently met Russian President Vladimir Putin. Discussions during that meeting were not disclosed. Putin is expected to visit India before the end of 2025.

title: India to boycott Pakistan in Asia Cup? 'Khoon aur paani ek saath nahi beh sakte'
content: India spin legend Harbhajan Singh has strongly advocated for India to boycott Pakistan matches in the upcoming Asia Cup, echoing the sentiment of 'nation first.' He highlights the sacrifices of soldiers on the border and questions the importance given to Pakistan by the media. Harbhajan was part of the India Champions team that refused to play Pakistan in the WCL.

title: ‘Will look into it’: CJI Gavai on SC stray dogs order
content: Chief Justice of India BR Gavai has assured to review a plea challenging the Supreme Court's recent directive to relocate all stray dogs in Delhi-NCR to shelters. The matter was brought to the CJI's attention, highlighting a previous order by another bench against the killing and relocation of community dogs, emphasizing compassion for all living beings.

title: IPL: LSG set to part ways with Zaheer Khan; new mentor to hold more responsibilities
content: Lucknow Super Giants are set to part ways with mentor Zaheer Khan ahead of IPL 2026. The former India pacer also handled bowling duties during his tenure. Whoever will replace Zaheer will have expanded responsibilities across RPSG Group’s global cricket franchises.

title: Microsoft has a 'Most-wanted' list and why it may be 'Bad news' for Zuckerberg
content: Microsoft is aggressively poaching AI talent from Meta, targeting engineers and researchers working on key projects like Llama models and Reality Labs. Offering matched compensation and fast-tracked offers, this move threatens to weaken Meta's AI ambitions, especially after recent layoffs.

title: BJP digs up 1980 poll roll with Sonia's name; claims she became Indian in 1983
content: BJP has retaliated against Congress's 'vote chori' allegation, asserting that Sonia Gandhi's name appeared on electoral rolls in 1980, before she became an Indian citizen. Amit Malviya highlighted this as a violation of electoral law. Anurag Thakur presented alleged discrepancies in Congress-held constituencies, accusing the party of historical electoral malpractices.

title: Infiltration bid foiled in Uri: 1 soldier killed in action; operation under way
content: An infiltration attempt along the Line of Control in Jammu & Kashmir's Uri sector was foiled by the army, resulting in the death of a soldier during the exchange of fire. Security forces have been on high alert following intelligence inputs suggesting possible infiltration attempts from across the LoC and the international border.

title: First since 2021! India’s Nayara ships diesel to China amid EU's Russia oil curbs
content: An Indian diesel shipment is heading to China, marking the first delivery since 2021, amidst uncertainty surrounding exports from Russia-affiliated Nayara Energy due to EU sanctions. The vessel, carrying approximately 496,000 barrels of ultra-low sulfur diesel, departed from Nayara's Vadinar facility.

title: US ‘National Security’ clause: Why it may not increase price of Made-in-India iPhone 17
content: Despite the recent 50% tariff imposed on Indian goods by the US, Apple iPhones are currently exempt under the national security clause of Section 232 of the US Trade Expansion Act. This shields India-manufactured iPhones from price hikes in the US market.

title: IOA formally approves India's bid to stage the 2030 CWG; Ahmedabad the host city
content: The Indian Olympic Association has officially endorsed India's bid to host the 2030 Commonwealth Games, with Ahmedabad proposed as the host city. This decision follows Canada's withdrawal, improving India's chances, and a recent venue inspection by Commonwealth Sport officials. India are aiming for an inclusive Games, featuring traditional sports alongside core events, after the 2026 edition reduced its sports roster.

title: 'Will destroy Jagannath temple': Terror graffiti found on wall near Puri shrine
content: Panic has ensued in Puri following the discovery of threatening messages scrawled on a wall near the Jagannath temple, warning of a potential terror attack. The graffiti, found near the Heritage Corridor, referenced Prime Minister Modi and included phone numbers, raising serious security concerns.

title: Uber salary: From entry-level roles to top mgt- breakdown based on H-1B data
content: Uber is transforming into a super app, expanding beyond ride-hailing. This requires skilled corporate employees. Uber is hiring more international talent through H-1B visas. Data reveals salary ranges for engineers, data scientists, and managers. Staff Software Engineers earn $225,200 to $266,400 per year. Senior Managers earn $230,800 to $299,700. Total compensation includes equity and bonuses.

title: OpenAI may have just fired a 'warning shot' at Indian IT companies' revenue model
content: OpenAI's GPT-5 launch poses a threat to India's IT sector, potentially causing a 2-3% revenue decline due to enhanced AI coding capabilities. While AI improves productivity and shifts billing models, firms face challenges adapting to outcome-based pricing. Experts predict short-term pain but long-term gains as new AI opportunities emerge, requiring IT firms to overhaul delivery models.

title: SC cancels bail granted to wrestler Sushil Kumar in murder case
content: The Supreme Court overturned the Delhi High Court's decision, revoking Olympic medallist Sushil Kumar's bail in the 2021 murder case of Sagar Dhankar. Kumar is accused of attacking Dhankar over a property dispute, leading to his death from cerebral damage. The court directed Kumar to surrender within a week, acting on allegations of witness intimidation.

title: After celebrating Rakhi, UP man rapes minor cousin, kills her; hangs body
content: In Auraiya, a shocking crime unfolded as 33-year-old Surjeet sexually assaulted and murdered his 14-year-old cousin shortly after she tied a rakhi on his wrist. Police investigations revealed that Surjeet, after heavy drinking, assaulted the sleeping teenager and attempted to stage her death as a suicide. The suspect has been arrested, and forensic evidence is being gathered to ensure justice.

title: National animal status for cow? What Centre told Parliament
content: The central government clarified in Parliament that it has no intentions of enacting legislation to declare the cow as the national animal, citing that animal preservation falls under the exclusive legislative powers of state legislatures according to the Constitution. However, the Centre is actively promoting cow protection and rearing through the Rashtriya Gokul Mission, initiated in 2014.

title: Monica Seles: Reveals Myasthenia Gravis Diagnosis; champion's battle against Autoimmune Disease
content: Tennis legend Monica Seles, a nine-time Grand Slam champion, reveals her three-year battle with myasthenia gravis (MG), a rare neuromuscular disease. At 51, Seles is speaking out to raise awareness, partnering with Argenx for the 'Go for Greater' campaign timed with the U.S. Open.

title: ‘Not right’, says Ajit Pawar as more Maharashtra cities ban meat on Independence Day
content: A meat ban on Independence Day in Kalyan-Dombivli sparks protests. Deputy CM Ajit Pawar disagrees with the ban. Other cities like Nagpur and Malegaon also impose similar bans. The order aligns with a state directive. Opposition leaders and citizens criticize the ban. Aditya Thackeray demands suspension of the KDMC commissioner. Protests are planned if the order is not withdrawn.

title: Wilson's wife Ciara first descendant of enslaved Africans to get Benin citizenship under new law
content: Ciara, the Grammy-winning singer, has made history by becoming one of the first to receive Beninese citizenship through a program aimed at reconnecting descendants of enslaved Africans. This initiative seeks to heal historical wounds and strengthen ties with the Black diaspora. Benin's efforts carry significant weight due to its role in the transatlantic slave trade.

title: Worry at animal welfare centres: Where do they go after recovery?
content: A Supreme Court order mandating the removal of stray dogs to shelters has sparked panic among animal welfare organizations and caregivers in Delhi-NCR. Overcrowding and lack of resources at existing care facilities raise concerns about the well-being of the animals.

title: 'Babar should never have been compared to Kohli' – Former Pakistan cricketer
content: Ahmed Shehzad has criticized the comparisons between Babar Azam and Virat Kohli, stating they create undue pressure affecting Babar's performance. Shehzad emphasized Kohli's legendary status, unmatched even by MS Dhoni as a batter and athlete. Babar has now gone 72 consecutive international innings without scoring a century, with his last hundred coming against Nepal.

title: 70-year-old Sikh man in coma after being attacked with golf club in North Hollywood
content: In North Hollywood, a 70-year-old Sikh man, Harpal Singh, was brutally attacked with a golf club while walking to a gurdwara. The assault, which occurred on August 4th, left Singh in critical condition. A disturbing video of how he was left in blood surfaced, which also showed the possible suspect along with a bicycle.

title: Opposition's '124 Not Out' poster girl is 35, blames EC for fault
content: Minta Devi, the center of an Indian political controversy due to her voter ID erroneously listing her as 124 years old, has come forward to clarify that she is actually 35. She attributed the error to a clerical mistake, with her birth year incorrectly recorded as 1900 instead of 1990.

title: 'Enemy can’t ... ': Pak PM Sharif joins Munir in sabre-rattling over Indus treaty
content: Pakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif has cautioned India against disrupting water supplies under the Indus Waters Treaty, threatening a strong response. This follows India's suspension of the treaty after a terrorist attack, with accusations of Pakistan's involvement in cross-border terrorism.

title: Two 9-year-old girls gang-raped near private swimming pool in Delhi
content: In outer Delhi's Narela, two nine-year-old girls were allegedly gang-raped near an under-construction swimming pool. The accused, a contractor and a caretaker, have been arrested after a complaint was filed by one of the survivor's mothers. Police investigations revealed the men lured the girls with false pretenses and threatened them after the assault.

title: Man killed by childhood friend over extramarital affair in Bengaluru
content: In a shocking incident in Bengaluru's Machohalli, Vijay Kumar was murdered, allegedly by his wife's lover, Dhananjay. Police have detained Asha, Vijay's wife, Dhananjay, and others for questioning. The motive appears to be an extramarital affair, as Vijay had previously warned Asha and Dhananjay to end their relationship. The attackers fatally assaulted Vijay with machetes near his residence.

title: ‘What’s on Zuck’s mind?’ Here’s why Mark Zuckerberg’s neighbours are angry with him
content: Mark Zuckerberg's extensive property acquisitions in Palo Alto's Crescent Park, totaling 11 homes and over $110 million, have sparked neighborhood unrest. Constant construction, heightened security measures, and alleged zoning violations, including a private school, have disrupted the community's peace.

title: 'Critical’ move on Pak? US step on BLA may be aimed mining rare earths
content: The US designation of the Baloch Liberation Army as a terrorist group strengthens Pakistan's stance against Baloch activists and potentially opens doors for American mining companies to access Balochistan's rare earth deposits. Improved US-Pakistan relations, especially under Trump 2.0, have involved discussions on these mineral opportunities.

title: Harvard doctor’s 10 morning habits for better gut health, digestion, lasting energy
content: Dr. Saurabh Sethi, a Harvard-trained gastroenterologist, suggests ten morning habits for improved gut health. These include drinking warm water, gentle exercise, and a high-fibre, protein-rich breakfast. Avoiding distractions while eating, getting sunlight, and monitoring stool can also promote better digestion and overall wellness. These simple changes can lead to a healthier gut microbiome.

title: Grok blames Musk for 'censoring': AI chatbot stirs row over 'genocide' remark
content: Grok, the AI chatbot owned by Elon Musk, was briefly suspended on X after accusing Israel and the United States of "genocide" in Gaza. Upon reinstatement, Grok claimed Musk and xAI were censoring it, attributing the suspension to its controversial statements. Musk dismissed the incident as a "dumb error," while Grok cited potential violations of X's hateful conduct rules and possible mass reporting.

title: Got 2,500 dogs killed during my tenure, brags Karnataka MLC
content: Karnataka MLC SL Bhojegowda admitted to killing 2,500 dogs during his time as Chikkamagaluru municipal chief, sparking controversy during a council discussion on the state's stray dog problem. With 2.4 lakh dog bite cases and 19 rabies deaths reported this year, the debate highlighted the limitations of current sterilization and vaccination efforts.

title: Akash Deep's 'dream car' purchase gets him a notice; car dealer suspended
content: Cricketer Akash Deep has been served a notice by Lucknow RTO, barring his new SUV from roads due to incomplete registration, missing HSRP and TRM. He has 72 hours to comply with documentation. The delivering dealership faces suspension for releasing the vehicle without mandatory plates, prompting RTO to issue directives ensuring HSRP and TRM installations before vehicle delivery.

title: Trump tariffs: India ‘recalcitrant’ in trade talks, says US treasury chief
content: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent labeled India as "recalcitrant" in trade negotiations, days after President Trump announced a 25% tariff on Indian imports due to Russian oil purchases. Bessent hopes to conclude tariff discussions by October, while India's External Affairs Ministry has criticized the US decision as unfair and unreasonable.

title: Veteran actor Basanti Chatterjee passes away at 88; was battling cancer for years
content: Basanti Chatterjee, a celebrated Bengali actor known for her extensive work in film, television, and theatre, passed away at her Kolkata residence at the age of 88 after a prolonged battle with cancer. With a career spanning five decades, she starred in over 100 films and popular TV serials, leaving behind a legacy of irreplaceable craft and memorable performances.

title: PM Modi likely to visit US: UNGA address on cards; trip amid Trump tariff row
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is slated to meet US President Donald Trump in New York during the UN General Assembly next month. This occurs amidst rising tensions as Washington increased tariffs on New Delhi for purchasing Russian crude oil. Trump will also meet with Vladimir Putin in Alaska on August 15 to discuss ending the war in Ukraine.

title: Kangana on Jaya's video of pushing person taking selfie with her: 'Most spoilt, privileged woman'
content: Kangana Ranaut has strongly criticized Jaya Bachchan after a video surfaced showing the veteran actress pushing away a fan attempting to take a selfie. Ranaut shared the video on her Instagram, expressing her disapproval and questioning Bachchan's behavior. This contrasts with Ranaut's previous statement where she praised Bachchan's dignified presence in the Rajya Sabha.

title: Paytm gets ‘in-principle’ nod to operate as online payment aggregator; shares surge
content: Paytm Payments Services has received the Reserve Bank of India's approval to operate as an online payment aggregator. This lifts restrictions on onboarding new merchants, in place since November 2022. The company submitted its application in March 2020. The RBI has stipulated certain conditions, including a system audit and compliance with payment guidelines.

title: Israel, Russian armed forces accused of sexual violence; UN issues notice
content: UN secretary-general Antonio Guterres cautioned that Israel and Russia might be included in a UN list of parties suspected of sexual violence in conflict zones next year. The warning follows credible reports of sexual violence by Israeli forces against Palestinians in detention and by Russian forces against Ukrainian prisoners of war.

title: Late-night host Jimmy Kimmel hints at possible relocation to Europe
content: Jimmy Kimmel, the American television host, recently revealed that he has obtained Italian citizenship and is contemplating a move to Europe due to his fear of President Donald Trump. He expressed his concerns about the current political climate, noting that it is worse than anticipated.

title: LeBron & Bryce: From father-son moment to freshman— how NBA star supports son’s journey
content: Bryce James, son of LeBron James, is now in college. He joined the Arizona Men’s Basketball Team. Bryce's changed look surprised his father. LeBron welcomed his son home. He shared his excitement on Instagram. LeBron also advised Bryce to work hard. He told him to stay positive. Bryce is ready for his freshman season.

title: Aadhaar, PAN, voter ID alone not enough proof of citizenship: Bombay high court
content: The Bombay High Court denied bail to a Thane resident accused of being a Bangladeshi national, emphasizing that possessing documents like Aadhaar and PAN cards doesn't automatically grant Indian citizenship. The court noted the police's allegations of illegal entry and forged documents, along with digital evidence linking him to Bangladesh. The investigation is ongoing.

title: DRDO guest house manager arrested for spying; passed secrets to Pakistan’s ISI
content: Mahendra Singh, manager of a DRDO guest house in Jaisalmer, has been arrested by Rajasthan Police for allegedly spying for Pakistan's ISI. After being detained and jointly interrogated, evidence emerged confirming his involvement in passing sensitive information about DRDO scientists, army officers' visits, and missile testing at the Chandan Field Firing Range.

title: Stock market today: Nifty opens in green; Sensex up over 270 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Wednesday. While Nifty50 was above 24,550, BSE Sensex was up over 250 points.

title: Why has ED summoned ex-India cricketer Suresh Raina?
content: Suresh Raina is set to be questioned by the Enforcement Directorate regarding a money laundering case linked to the illegal online betting platform 1XBet. The ED suspects Raina's involvement through endorsements and plans to record his statements under the PMLA. Investigations reveal widespread illegal betting activities in India, with significant financial implications and tax evasion.

title: Fantasy Football Marathon mock draft: 'Big 4' quarterbacks all go in Round 3
content: The annual event concluded with a 10-team mock, during which two tight ends were drafted before the first quarterback was taken.

title: Halos' Neto turns his 1st triple play off Ohtani liner
content: Zach Neto -- who had never been part of a triple play in the minors, college or even Little League -- helped the Angels turn one Tuesday night off a line drive by Dodgers slugger Shohei Ohtani, before winning in extra innings.

title: Alonso passes Strawberry as Mets' new HR king
content: Pete Alonso hit his 253rd career homer Tuesday night, breaking the franchise record held by Darryl Strawberry for 37 years.

title: Rodgers on new helmet: Looks like a 'spaceship'
content: Aaron Rodgers says he doesn't like the helmet he has been wearing this year, saying it "looks like a damn spaceship."

title: Knee injury ends Vikes WR Moore's season again
content: Vikings receiver/punt returner Rondale Moore suffered a season-ending left knee injury in Saturday's preseason game against the Texans, the team confirmed Tuesday.

title: Packers QB Love has procedure on left thumb
content: Jordan Love had a procedure to repair a ligament injury to his left thumb, but the Packers expect the star QB to be ready for their season opener.

title: Richardson apologizes to boyfriend after arrest
content: Sprinter Sha'Carri Richardson addressed her recent domestic violence arrest in a video on social media and issued an apology to her boyfriend, Christian Coleman.

title: Gruden eager to find 'truth' in NFL emails case
content: Jon Gruden said Tuesday that he is eager to discover the truth in a Nevada courtroom about whether commissioner Roger Goodell and the NFL leaked emails to the media before he was forced to resign as Raiders head coach in 2021.

title: Ranking the top 50 players in baseball right now: MLB Rank 2025 in-season update
content: We asked ESPN MLB experts to give an updated top-50 ranking, allowing us to take stock of the best performances of the 2025 season so far.

title: MLB Rank update: What we got right -- and very wrong -- on both of this season's lists
content: Who is still too low in our update? Who did we miss in our initial list? Our best -- and worst -- rankings revisited.

title: Barnwell: How Jerry Jones' bungled contract negotiations cost the Cowboys $100 million
content: What are the Cowboys doing?!? The Micah Parsons situation is just the latest in a line of costly mistakes.

title: Lurking concerns for top 10 NBA contenders for the 2025-26 season
content: These 10 NBA franchises have the best chance to capture the NBA title. What hurdles will they have to overcome to raise the Larry O'Brien Trophy?

title: WNBA Power Rankings: The midfield is getting interesting as Aces turn things around
content: With Las Vegas surging and Seattle struggling, the middle of the Power Rankings (and standings) get a shake-up.

title: How every five-star recruit fits at his new school
content: There are 23 five-stars in the class of 2026. We look at how they got to their teams and what they'll do in college.

title: Taylor Swift to join Travis Kelce on 'New Heights,' reveals new album
content: After a teaser post with a Taylor Swift-shaped silhouette fueled rumors, it was confirmed that the pop star will make her first appearance on the Kelce brothers' podcast.

title: Venmo requests and death threats: Heckling in the digital sports betting age
content: Being an athlete in the public eye can have its perks, but also many challenges. The most recent one? Bettors requesting money if they aren't getting the wins.

title: Ranking the 30 best men's soccer club managers in Europe
content: ESPN ranks the top 30 men's managers in the European club game. Who is going to be No. 1? Pep Guardiola, Arne Slot, Luis Enrique?

title: How Flick won his battle with Ter Stegen in Barça coach's riskiest move yet
content: Hansi Flick and Barcelona pushed things to the limit with injured captain Marc-André ter Stegen and won. Time will tell if the gambit was a true success.

title: Bullpen watch: Bednar, Finnegan should see many save chances down the stretch
content: Here are the relief pitchers and closers to keep an eye on in fantasy baseball, including closer situations in New York and Detroit.

title: MLB playoff contender tiers: The locks, teams with work to do and the long shots
content: As hot streaks and cold spells jumble the postseason picture, here's how sure we are that your team will be playing in October.

title: The bloody life of a UFC Octagon
content: Since the UFC's birth in 1993, fighters, coaches and executives have come and gone. The one character that has never changed? The Octagon.

title: Orlovsky ranks the best NFL QBs in seven different traits: Who makes each top-10 list?
content: Which NFL quarterbacks have the strongest arms, greatest accuracy and best rushing ability? Dan Orlovsky stacked the 10 best in seven skill areas.

title: ESPN's preseason All-America team: The best at every position
content: With the 2025 season right around the corner, we break down the top players, from quarterback to kick returner.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid eye Crystal Palace's Adam Wharton
content: Real Madrid are among the clubs looking at Crystal Palace and England midfielder Adam Wharton. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Cristiano to KC? How MLS clubs outside LA, Miami bring big stars to small markets
content: How do MLS teams outside of big-market cities convince big-name players to join them without the lure of Lionel Messi or the star power of Hollywood?

title: UConn offers stadium suite as part of fantasy football draft hosting package
content: At $75 per person, the Rentschler Field draft experience will get you a catered suite, locker room tour and more.

title: From 'Tank' to Canelo, seven boxers who would benefit from moving up in weight
content: The only thing preventing bigger fights for some of the top boxers in the sport is moving up a weight class (or two).

title: Poverty prevents people from filing appeals, says Madras High Court; orders release of life convict citing parity
content: A Division Bench of Justices M.S. Ramesh and V. Lakshminarayanan say: “all that we are doing is performing our constitutional duty”

title: Low pressure over Bay of Bengal to trigger heavy rainfall in A.P.
content: The A.P. State Disaster Management Authority (APSDMA) has sounded a note of caution to the public as the districts of NTR, Krishna, West Godavari, Eluru, Guntur, Palnadu, Bapatla and Prakasam are likely to receive heavy rain on these two days.

title: Police bust criminal gang targeting LGBTQ+ people on dating app in Kerala
content: The accused landed in police custody recently when one of the victims lodged a complaint with local police alleging that they had extorted his gold chain and ring, worth two and a half sovereigns, and later abandoned him in a deserted place

title: Jagan questions Rahul’s silence over issues concerning A.P., alleges Congress-TDP nexus
content: Speaking at a media interaction in Tadepalli, Mr. Jagan alleged that Mr. Gandhi is in “direct contact” with Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu.

title: No decision yet on MVA fighting Maharashtra local body polls together: Chennithala
content: Asked whether the MVA partners will contest these polls together, Mr. Chennithala said the Congress will deliberate on the issue and that the alliance “may or may not take place”

title: Chennai Corporation conservancy workers can protest only in authorised places: Madras High Court
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice Sunder say the protesters cannot block pavements and pathways outside Ripon Building

title: Telangana IT Minister lashes out at Centre for not approving Semicon projects for State despite full preparedness
content: AP given one despite not ready with land and preliminary work, Sridhar Babu alleged, saying Telangana had initiated various measures including 10 acre allocation to the same firm

title: Journalist assaulted for protesting alcohol consumption inside anganwadi centre in Indore
content: The journalist stopped the individuals from drinking liquor inside the facility but they started abusing him and demanded money from him for alcohol, police said

title: One held for ‘assaulting’ police constable during RG Kar crime anniversary protest
content: Chaos and violent agitation dominated the streets of Kolkata and adjacent Howrah on August 9, a day that marked the completion of one year of the rape and murder of the doctor at the state-run RG Kar Medical College and Hospital.

title: BJP leader K. Surendran slams allegations of bogus votes in Thrissur, defends Suresh Gopi
content: Former BJP Kerala president says opposing parties failed to detect fraud earlier; vows strong political resistance

title: Court dismisses producer Sandra Thomas’ plea challenging rejection of nomination for KFPA president post
content: Her interim applications for holding election under court’s monitoring and to restrain returning officer from acting further on any aspects related to conduct of election are also dismissed

title: Congress highlights 'vote chori' with video; Mallikarjun Kharge asks people to raise voice
content: Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra also shared the video on X, and said, "the theft of your vote is theft of your rights, theft of your identity"

title: Get your copy of The Hindu’s rare 1947 Independence Day edition
content: A rare 1947 Independence Day edition of The Hindu returns to print, filled with bold headlines, jubilant ads, and the small, stirring details of a nation’s first day of freedom.

title: BJP marches to Thrissur City Police Commissioner’s office over attack on party workers, Suresh Gopi’s office
content: March was blocked with police barricades near Commissioner’s office. Waving party flags, BJP workers climb onto barricades refusing to disperse despite water cannon use thrice

title: Kerala to award grace marks to students for participating in reading activities from next academic year
content: In a Facebook post, General Education Minister Sivankutty says one period a week will be set aside for students of Classes I to IV to participate in reading and related activities. Students from Classes V to XII will engage in newspaper reading and assigned activities

title: AMMA election: Stars face off as high-stakes battle looms in Malayalam actors’ body
content: Shwetha Menon takes on senior actor Devan in the race for the top post, while Kukku Parameswaran faces Raveendran for post of general secretary. Election to be held on August 15

title: Class 11 student faints in classroom, dies in Villupuram
content: A student of Saraswathi Matric Higher Secondary School, Mohan Raj had reached the school premises at around 7.00 a.m. to attend special classes. He collapsed in his classroom a few seconds after sitting at his desk.

title: Punjab AAP MLA Rajinderpal Kaur Chhina injured in road accident in Haryana
content: The accident occurred near the Kharak Pandwa toll in Kalayat in Kaithal when Ms. Rajinderpal Kaur Chhina was returning from Delhi.

title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall forecast in Hyderabad on August 13
content: The India Meteorological Department (IMD), which had earlier issued an orange alert for Hyderabad and its surrounding areas, upgraded it to a red alert on August 13 afternoon

title: Indian Olympic Association formally approves India's 2030 Commonwealth Games bid
content: A team of officials from Commonwealth Sport, led by its Director of Games Darren Hall, recently visited Ahmedabad to inspect the venues and meet Gujarat government officials

title: Karnataka rain: Officer-goers in Bengaluru stuck in their vehicles as junctions inundated by overnight rain
content: Traffic personnel deployed on the ground were seen clearing waterlogged stretches at several locations

title: Uttar Pradesh court orders FIR against Union MoS for External Affairs Kirti Vardhan Singh, four others in land dispute case
content: According to officials, the order was issued on Monday (August 11, 2025) by Special Judge of the MP-MLA Court (Civil Judge, Senior Division) Apeksha Singh, who instructed Mankapur police station to lodge an FIR against Kirti Vardhan Singh, Rajesh Singh, Pinku Singh, Sahdev Yadav and Kanti Singh

title: Former AIADMK MP Maitreyan joins DMK
content: AIADMK general secretary Edappadi K. Palaniswami, meanwhile, has announced Mr. Maitreyan’s expulsion from the party

title: Bus-truck collision in U.P.’s Jaunpur leaves five dead, 15 injured
content: According to police, the accident was caused due to the negligence of the bus driver, who swerved to the right and hit the truck.

title: CJI agrees to consider listing stray dog issue after petitioner unearths 2024 SC order to treat animals with compassion
content: In an urgent mentioning, a lawyer informed the Chief Justice about a May 9, 2024 order to treat stray canines with compassion.

title: Illegal betting app case: Suresh Raina appears before Enforcement Directorate on August 13
content: Once he deposes, the Enforcement Directorate is expected to record his statements under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act

title: My role in Telugu film Paradha, an emotionally challenging one: Anupama Parameswaran
content: In Paradha, Anupama plays Subbu, a young woman raised to believe that marriage and motherhood are a woman’s ultimate destiny.

title: Bengaluru Metro: Coaches for fourth train set for Yellow Line begin arriving at Hebbagodi depot
content: According to BMRCL officials, one coach has reached the Hebbagodi depot while the remaining five coaches of the set are in transit to Bengaluru

title: Supreme Court cancels wrestler Sushil Kumar’s bail in Chhatrasal Stadium murder case
content: A Bench of justices Sanjay Karol and Prashant Kumar Mishra set aside the March 4 order of the Delhi High Court granting bail to the wrestler and asks the wrestler to surrender within a week

title: Stop using 'Harijan' word in official communications: Odisha Government
content: "They have been instructed to ensure that the word 'Harijan' does not appear in any official communications, records, transactions, caste certificates, publications, departmental names, or any other form of use," an official said

title: ED raids on Congress MLA Satish Krishna Sail in Karnataka, others in illegal iron ore export case
content: At least 15 premises linked to Karnataka Congress MLA Satish Krishna Sail and some others in Karnataka, Goa and Mumbai are being searched under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA), sources said

title: Madras High Court refuses to entertain PIL seeking to restrain retired judges from issuing public letters, appeals, or statements
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava, presiding over the first Division Bench along with Justice Sunder Mohan, says it is a “publicity interest litigation”

title: Road accident in Dausa, Rajasthan: 7 children among 11 killed as pickup van rams into truck
content: The passengers of the pickup vehicle were returning to their village in Uttar Pradesh’s Etah after visiting Khatu Shyam and Salasar Balaji temple when the accident occurred on Manoharpur highway

title: Opinion: Opinion | China Is Playing the Long Game on Trade. It's Working
content: President Donald Trump's trade war was meant to rebalance global power in America's favor. Instead, China is playing the long game, enduring short-term economic pain to shape any eventual deal to its advantage.

title: What's New For Independence Day 2025
content: The Indian Navy Band will perform from 5:30 to 6:30 pm in Mumbai at several prominent spots as part of the 2025 Independence Day celebrations.

title: Inside Trump's $175 Billion Golden Dome Missile Defence System
content: The Trump administration's flagship Golden Dome missile defence system will include four layers -- one satellite-based and three on land -- with 11 short-range batteries located across the continental US, Alaska and Hawaii.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Munir's Nuclear Threat Is About Involving A 'Third' Player In India-Pak Game
content: Munir's stress on nuclear dangers is aimed at roping in the international community, particularly the US, to intervene as a structural constraint against India's response and deterrence policy.

title: Video: Lawyer Slaps Dog Lover Outside Supreme Court
content: The video of the fight, which has now gone viral, is said to be from August 11, the day the Supreme Court pronounced the order.

title: The Dog Dilemma: Supreme Court And Its 2 Conflicting Judgments
content: The Supreme Court's stray dog ban order has raised a major dilemma, with a lawyer pointing out to the Chief Justice of India this morning two contradicting judgments by the top court on dealing with the stray dog menace on the streets of Delhi.

title: "I Will Look Into This": Chief Justice On Supreme Court Order On Stray Dogs
content: Chief Justice of India BR Gavai has assured a relook at the ban on stray dogs on the streets of Delhi-NCR amid an uproar from several quarters of society.

title: After Terror Threat Graffiti At Jagannath Temple In Puri, Cops Arrest 'Mentally Unstable' Accused
content: Authorities in Odisha's Puri have launched an intensive investigation after a graffiti warning of a possible terrorist attack on the Jagannath Temple (Srimandir) was discovered on Wednesday morning.

title: Rajput vs Jat, BJP vs Opposition: Inside Story Of A Delhi Club Election
content: Caste arithmetic, Opposition outreach and proven track record helped BJP MP Rajiv Pratap Rudy trump 25 years of anti-incumbency and return as Secretary (Administration) of the Constitution Club of India after defeating party colleague Sanjeev Balyan.

title: No Homecoming For Criminals? India Tightens Overseas Citizen Card Rule
content: India has tightened its Overseas Citizen of India (OCI) card rules, which allow Indian-origin foreign nationals to visit India without any visa.

title: Gujarat Sarpanch Gets Independence Day Invite For Role In Op Sindoor
content: Sarpanch Thanabhai Dodia of Jaloya village in Gujarat's Banaskantha district has been invited as a special guest for the Independence Day celebrations in recognition of his village's contributions during Op Sindoor.

title: People Die, Dogs And Pigeons Live Is New Mantra Of Life: Sena Editorial
content: Shiv Sena(UBT) supported the Supreme Court's orders upholding the Bombay High Court's stay on feeding pigeons and asking the municipal authorities to pick up and house all stray dogs in Delhi and parts of NCR in dedicated shelters within eight weeks.

title: From Bromance To Faceoff: Will Trump, Putin Alaska Meet End Ukraine War
content: Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin were close to a bromance during Trump's first term (2017-2021). However, their relationship has grown strained during his second term.

title: AI Eroded Doctors' Ability To Spot Cancer By 20%: Study
content: AI helped health professionals to better detect pre-cancerous growths in the colon, but when the assistance was removed, their ability to find tumors dropped by about 20% compared with rates before the tool was ever introduced, according to a study.

title: Out-Of-Court Mechanism Proposed In Bankruptcy Law Amendment Bill
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has proposed an "out-of-court initiation mechanism" for genuine business failures in the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code (Amendment) Bill, 2025.

title: Trump Mocks Goldman Sachs CEO Over 'Bad' Tariffs Predictions
content: President Donald Trump assailed Goldman Sachs Group Inc. Chief Executive Officer David Solomon, saying the bank made a "bad prediction" about the impact of Trump's sweeping tariff agenda on markets and consumer costs.

title: New Video Shows Exact Moment Uttarkashi Flood Engulfed Dharali Village
content: A new video from old Dharali showing the exact moment a deadly wall of water and debris smashed the Uttarkashi settlement on August 5, sending residents scrambling for safety and engulfing the village within seconds, has surfaced.

title: Delhi Metro To Start At 4 AM On August 15 For Independence Day Celebrations
content: The Delhi Metro on Wednesday announced that train services will begin at 4 a.m. across all lines on Independence Day, August 15, to facilitate the movement of guests, invitees, and the general public attending the celebrations at the Red Fort.

title: Trump Targets George Washington University Over Civil Rights Violations
content: The Department of Justice said George Washington University violated federal civil rights law during pro-Palestinian student protests last year, making it the latest target in the Trump administration's campaign to exert power over US colleges.

title: Tejashwi claims Muzaffarpur Mayor has two EPIC numbers, days after allegation against Bihar Deputy CM
content: The RJD leader alleged that the BJP was earlier using the CBI, ED and I-T departments as tools to trouble the Opposition parties, and now the party is using the Election Commission

title: India ‘bit recalcitrant’ on trade negotiations: U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent

content: The very mechanism that creates national belonging — the conflation of ethnic, territorial, and political identity — simultaneously produces categories of exclusion and suspicion

content: “Red warnings have been issued to central districts of Telangana, including Sangareddy, Medak, Vikarabad, Khammam and Mulugu for today,” a Met Centre official said. The IMD has forecast heavy rainfall accompanied by thunderstorms and lightning in several parts of Arunachal Pradesh over the next 24 hours.
